channel.title: Man 'accidentally shot girlfriend - and then himself'

item.title: Man 'accidentally shot girlfriend - and then himself'
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:22, topic:390974”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=486923.msg3572925#msg3572925 date=1303183688]

numb nuts for having it loaded and not having safety on, +1 for no guns.

Of course, then we should also ban cars, scissors, electricity, fire, and just about everything else right? Since they all can and do kill people every day, far more often than gun accident, which are almost always preventable.
[/quote]

Without proper training guns should not be allowed for the masses.[/quote]

Absolutely! Just like you can’t drive a car without training and the proper license, you can’t carry a weapon without training and the proper license. Same thing.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:16, topic:390974”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=486923.msg3572777#msg3572777 date=1303176997]
numb nuts for having it loaded and not having safety on, +1 for no guns.
[/quote]
Of course, then we should also ban cars, scissors, electricity, fire, and just about everything else right? Since they all can and do kill people every day, far more often than gun accident, which are almost always preventable.[/quote]

Without proper training guns should not be allowed for the masses.

item.source: Man 'accidentally shot girlfriend - and then himself'

item.title: Man 'accidentally shot girlfriend - and then himself'
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:16, topic:390974”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=486923.msg3572741#msg3572741 date=1303174442]

It doesn’t seem like this could possibly happen like it says in the article. How do you not know that a shotgun has a round in the chamber, or at least not take the 0.2 seconds to check before you start to play with it. Idiots…

Happened with my grandpa and a 270 once. Luckily, the barrel was pointed no where near him and no one else was in the house. Next time I’m at his house I’ll get a picture of the hole that is still in the wall of the closet.
[/quote]
I’m 99% sure you mean 870, as in Remington 870. Still, idiot to not make sure it’s unloaded at least a few times before cleaning it. At least your grandpa practiced the next rule, always keep a gun pointed in a safe direction, regardless of if it loaded or not. The guy in this thread didn’t.[/quote]
I meant 270 as in the round I don’t remember the exact model of the rifle, and we sold it a while ago. Anyways, the gun went off as he was pulling it out of the closet, so there wasn’t much he could do. He never hunted with it, it was either my stepdad or one of my uncles that put it away still loaded.

Anyways, always treat a gun like it’s loaded :\

Read full topic
item.source: Man 'accidentally shot girlfriend - and then himself'

item.title: Man 'accidentally shot girlfriend - and then himself'
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:13, topic:390974”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=486923.msg3568682#msg3568682 date=1302873199]
It doesn’t seem like this could possibly happen like it says in the article. How do you not know that a shotgun has a round in the chamber, or at least not take the 0.2 seconds to check before you start to play with it. Idiots…
[/quote]
Happened with my grandpa and a 270 once. Luckily, the barrel was pointed no where near him and no one else was in the house. Next time I’m at his house I’ll get a picture of the hole that is still in the wall of the closet.[/quote]
I’m 99% sure you mean 870, as in Remington 870. Still, idiot to not make sure it’s unloaded at least a few times before cleaning it. At least your grandpa practiced the next rule, always keep a gun pointed in a safe direction, regardless of if it loaded or not. The guy in this thread didn’t.

Ollie:

numb nuts for having it loaded and not having safety on, +1 for no guns.

Of course, then we should also ban cars, scissors, electricity, fire, and just about everything else right? Since they all can and do kill people every day, far more often than gun accident, which are almost always preventable.

Read full topic

item.description:
@haticks wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:14, topic:390974”]numb nuts for having it loaded and not having safety on, +1 for no guns.[/quote]Because one idiot manages to kill himself with something doesn’t mean they should be banned. If that was the case, you’d be surprised how little you’d have…

+1 for regulation. Not removal.

my exact thoughts
